item.title: Ancient beech tree, Glenariff Forest Park, County Antrim, Northern Ireland
item.description: 图文来源自：bing. copyright: © Dawid K Photography/Shutterstock Ever wondered what it’s like to stroll through a storybook? Welcome to Glenariff Forest Park in County Antrim, Northern Ireland. This park spans nearly 3,000 acres of woodland, waterfalls, and wonder, and it boasts several walking trails, each offering its own unique perspective of the landscape. The most popular is the Waterfall Walkway, a 3-mile trail that passes through a National Nature Reserve and features the Ess-na-Crub and Ess-na-Larach waterfalls.
